alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Dickens; Floyd (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 11:28PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Dickens, eastern Floyd, northeastern Crosby and Motley Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1127 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of South Plains to 10 miles east of Cone. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Matador, Dickens, Flomot, Dougherty, Afton, Mcadoo and Roaring Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
